thread.title: Dash cam footage released of incident involving Johnny Manziel
thread.title_full: Dash cam footage released of incident involving Johnny Manziel

title: Dash cam footage released of incident involving Johnny Manziel
text:
Dash cam footage released of incident involving Johnny Manziel John Breech, CBSSports 7:52 a.m. EDT October 20, 2015 Cleveland Browns quarterback Johnny Manziel (2) warms up before the game between the Cleveland Browns and the Denver Broncos at FirstEnergy Stadium. (Photo: Ken Blaze-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT 5 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Police in Ohio have released the dash cam footage that was taken when Browns quarterback Johnny Manziel and his girlfriend, Colleen Crowley, were pulled over last week . 
In the footage, which was obtained by Fox 8 in Cleveland, you can hear Manziel explain his side of the situation to police. 
"[Colleen] threw her wallet out of the window. I pulled up into this driveway right here and then told her you need to get out, turn around and get out look for my wallet," Manziel says on the video. "After that happened, she threw her phone out the window." 
At some point, Crowley apparently tried to jump out of the car. 
"I grabbed her arm, something like this," Manziel explained, "'Hey, get in the car, get in the car, go home. I'll come back and find [our stuff] later.'" 
Although police discovered an abrasion on Crowley's left wrist and both parties admitted to alcohol being involved, no one was charged in the incident. 
Police found Manziel and Crowley and pulled the duo over after getting two separate 911 calls regarding Manziel's car. 
In one call, you can hear the caller describe the situation. 
"There's a lady in the passenger's seat trying to jump out. The guy is holding her, holding her neck," the caller said, via Cleveland.com . 
In the other call, Manziel can he heard in the background saying that he's sober and that he's just "trying to take [Crowley] home." 
Although Manziel said he was sober, he did later admit to police that he had taken some alcoholic drinks earlier in the day. 
The incident last week comes only six months after Manziel spent 10 weeks in a treatment facility. 
Both Manziel and Crowley took to social media to say that the incident wasn't a big deal. 
Manziel was active for the Browns game against Denver on Sunday, a decision that Browns coach Mike Pettine defended on Monday, "[Manziel] knows what's expected of him," Pettine said, via Cleveland.com . "He's made huge strides around this building." Read or Share this story: http://on.wtsp.com/1LI3u2U TOP VIDEOS
